Decent movie. Didn't suck but wasn't good.

What a lousy thing to associate with Christmas -- that there is nothing to look forward to after death but black nothingness.

TOTALLY CONTRARY to Christmas and the GLAD TIDINGS that there is plenty to look forward to in the next life.

I guess that's why cgaurav007 titled it MERRY X-MAS to avoid anyone learning that CHRIST-mas is not a holiday for hordes waiting to enter the black nothingness but celebrating the BIRTHDAY of Jesus CHRIST which gives us hope.

As Gardner's character learns in the end, the movie's basic premise is flawed in concluding that speaking the truth means we have to say any hurtful and unloving thing that pops into our head.

At least LOVE triumphs in the end because GOD is LOVE, not THE MAN IN THE SKY.

Actually, archeological evidence shows that Jesus was born about half a dozen years before the Year 0, and most historians believe that he was born in summer time. Fact is Christmas was adopted from an already existing pagan holiday in order to facilitate more converts to the New Faith just like most other Christian holidays. You see, the night on the 24th of December was in many places in Europe the shortest day of the year, and carried religious significance for nature worshippers since that date symbolized the days of the year getting longer and longer again, with the promise of spring returning soon.

Besides, they just put it in the title to wish us a happy holiday, so stop bitching :P

People that say this sucks are saying it because it mocks their religion. It does make fun of the bible. The atheists that produced this movie are entitled to there opinion. I am a far right conservative, but I still got a laugh out of "an inconvenient truth". I still thought the beginning of this was funny but I soon realised the the point they were trying to make. No problem, I doubt many Christians that see this will continue to line rickys pockets. I for one will only download the office now(I will still let the guy entertain me- but I will no longer support him). Entertainers should entertain. If they want to be involved in politics and religion, they should do that and stop entertaining- If they are good at what they do(like the douche bag michael  moorer) then they will be successful. It was a good comedy. Ironic that 007 posted this on the day regarded a the birthday of Jesus. The people that say it sucks should say why they don't like the movie and not support the people involved rather than to say that this good comedy sucks. The message sucked, the movie was entertaining and quite funny. When ricky and his buddies are burning in hell, they will better understand.
